title: Here’s why Boston streets seem clearer than after the last big storm
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston implemented an extended parking ban post-blizzard, aiding efficient snow removal and clear streets.
Mayor Wu reported 200 truckloads of snow removed in one day due to daytime hauling efforts.
The city considers additional fees for property owners who fail to clear sidewalks after snowstorms.

title: This Mass. bride and groom skied Killington fresh off their vows and in wedding attire
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Evan and Kristyn Stark skied at Killington, Vermont, in wedding attire after their ceremony on February 7.
The wedding took place at the Killington Grand Hotel, with the couple skiing before their slopeside reception.
Kristyn, a lifelong skier, and Evan bonded over skiing from their first meeting on the dating app Hinge.

title: Report: Anfernee Simons played with wrist fracture during time with Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Anfernee Simons played 49 games with the Celtics this season averaging 14.2 points without missing any games.
Simons aggravated a wrist fracture during Boston Celtics training camp and is currently out with an old injury.
Celtics traded Simons and a second-round pick to the Bulls for Nikola Vucevic, who averages 9.9 points in seven games.

title: MBTA Commuter Rail experiences more delays due to snow cleanup and vehicle on track
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MBTA Commuter Rail faced delays due to snow cleanup on Fairmount, Fall River/New Bedford, and several other lines.
A vehicle on the Worcester line tracks was cleared, but weather-related issues persist across the network.
Nearly three feet of snow in parts of the network is hindering cleanup and affecting rail service operations.

title: All Mass. residents to get free access to Google AI training classes, Healey says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts residents will have free access to Google's AI and tech course via the Grow with Google program.
Governor Maura Healey emphasized the importance of AI, aiming to make Massachusetts an AI hub, with $100 million allocated for development.
The initiative offers AI courses for varied audiences aiming to enhance 'high-growth' skills in tech, free until end of 2027.

title: Charlie McAvoy apologizes for Team USA’s reaction to Trump joke about US women’s team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy apologized for Team USA's response to a joke made by Donald Trump about the US women's hockey team.
Trump made a joke about inviting the US women's hockey team to the White House, leading to laughter from the men's team.
US women's team captain Hilary Knight called the joke "distasteful"; the women's team declined Trump's White House invitation.

title: Mayor Jake Wilson plans to tackle Somerville’s housing crisis. Will it work?
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Mayor Jake Wilson plans to address Somerville's housing crisis with increased density, new zoning, and investment in affordable housing.
The 299 Broadway development will feature 288 units, with 132 affordable units at 30% and 60% AMI, demonstrating potential models.
Wilson supports a statewide initiative to limit rent increases, while exploring expansion of social housing to stabilize housing costs.

title: Watch this wild (and inspirational) video out of New Bedford following the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: New Bedford, struggling with unplowed side streets post-blizzard, saw locals resort to DIY snow clearance.
Local Scott Vicente navigated unplowed streets with difficulty, mainly using his pickup truck to tackle snowy roads.
Residents, including Allie Crane, witnessed numerous vehicles getting stuck, highlighting community efforts during the storm.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 26, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Chef Douglass Williams to open coastal Italian tavern La Tavernetta in East Boston by Spring 2026.
Salt & Straw ice cream expanding to Boston's Seaport, offering unique flavors like blue cheese and balsamic strawberry.
Italian eatery Sorella Cucina Toscana opens in Burlington, offering pasta, crudo, and veal osso bucco.

title: Patriots still deciding what former defensive coordinator Terrell Williams’s role will be
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Former Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will hold a high-ranking role on Mike Vrabel’s staff.
Williams overcame prostate cancer last season, which led to a virtual work stint and missing some games.
Zak Kuhr was promoted to defensive coordinator after leading the team to a 14-2 finish last season.
